title: Honey-Soy Glazed Salmon with Crispy Pork Belly
description: A perfectly seared salmon with a sweet-savory glaze, topped with crispy pork belly bits and served over steamed white rice. The glaze creates a beautiful lacquer while the pork adds a rich, crispy texture contrast.

Glaze Preparation.text: Mix all glaze ingredients in a small bowl

Main Steps.text: Cook pork belly until crispy, set aside
Pat salmon dry and bring to room temperature
Heat non-stick pan over medium-high heat
Cook salmon skin-side up for 4 minutes
Flip, add glaze, and spoon over salmon for 2-3 minutes until done

notes: Don't move the salmon while it's searing to ensure proper caramelization
The glaze can burn due to honey content - watch heat carefully
Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork but still maintains a slightly translucent center
storage: Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days
Reheat gently to avoid overcooking the salmon
